review_blob: A very tasty ESB.  Poured a light copper color.  Head was about an inch and left a nice lacing down the sides of the glass.  The hops were very evident in the aroma, but I had to deduct a few points because I also noticed some "off" aromas.  The taste was wonderfully hoppy, but not too bitter.  The hops flavor remains through the aftertaste, but not much else.  Overall, I think this is a well-balanced ESB and I would definitely buy it again.

A rather average lager.  Pours a golden/straw color with many bubbles and a half-inch thin head.  Not much of an aroma.  Flavor had a hint of corn and whatnot.  Overall, this is a very average beer.  Not bad, but nothing to run and tell anyone about.

This beer poured a very dark brown with a half-inch, light brown head.  The head dissipated after about a minute and did not leave much on the sides of the glass.  You can smell the chocolate malt and the sweetness of this beer.  This sweet malty flavor lingers from the first sip to the aftertaste. (In a good way.)  A bit sweet for my taste, but I would certainly order another.
Delicious beer.  Poured a bright brownish-orange color with a half-inch white head that dissipated fairly quickly.  Great hops flavor without being too over the top.
Yellow golden color and very bubbly.  Holds a half-inch head for a while.  This lager is very similar to Corona but perhaps a bit richer.  Overall, its good, but pretty average.

Best beer for the price.  Light golden color and minimal head.  Not much of an aroma, but also no bad aroma.  Easy to drink and no bad aftertaste.  This is truly a rating on price.  I was very surprised when this $12 case of 16oz beers turned out to be even drinkable.    I actually enjoyed them, and will definitely buy this again in the future.  As an added bonus, you even get $1.50 back when you return the empty bottles.  Purchased in West View, PA 15229 at "Northern Beer Traders".

This beer is a wonderful, slightly red, copper color.  You can smell everything that went into making this fine brew.  (Although I havent learned to identify everything yet.)  A little bitter, but still one of the tastiest beers Ive ever had.
Only good for situations when you need a refreshing beverage and it must be beer.  Not much carbonation.  Not much flavor.  You can drink it like water and still get a buzz.
This is the beer that turned me onto IPAs.  Looks great in the glass and has a great aroma.  Its also very smooth on the palate with great hop flavors.
